intro: Serjania cissoides, commonly known as the Brazilian apple or cipó-de-ferro, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Serjania cissoides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
